content.description: Short bolted climb with crux exit moves. Good warm-up.
content.location: Rightmost climb on the Lower Sunset Wall. Shares anchor with the climb Crystal Whipped. Situated to the left of the 4th class scramble to the Middle Sunset ledge.

content.description: A classic hardman crack! Climb the thin left leaning incipient finger crack just right of No Jam Crack. Begin with a few tricky moves to get off the ground. Then continue to work your way up and left to a single piton. Here the crack tapers out for a few feet and leaves you with a distinct technical and bouldery crux. Fire the crux and keep it together through a few more moves followed by slightly easier but still very sustained terrain to the top. Well worth the trip over to it if you’re up for the challenge. The gear is tricky to place and slightly runout in a few sections.
content.protection: .1”-1” cams, stoppers, C3’s, aliens, 1 piton, bolt anchor.
content.location: Just left of Sunset Crack and just right of No Jam Crack, Super Sunset Crack is the the thin left leaning incipient crack with a single piton on it about half way up.

content.description: You'll know this one when you see it.  Follow a hand crack in a shallow, left facing corner as it thins and tapers off to nothing on the face above.  Step up and right, clip a bolt, and head for the top.  Tape up!
content.protection: Gear, hands to fingers, one bolt.  Shuts at the top.
content.location: Near the middle of lower Sunset Wall

content.description:
If you love crack climbing, this is one for you.  

  Licheny, coarse, and loveable.  

  This one doesn't let up, including the coarseness of the granite, but the hand jams are great.  Two #3s are helpful.
content.protection: Belay off of a tree about 40 yards back.  Rap off of obvious Arborist anchors up and climber's right.
content.location: Downhill about 70 yards from the Arborist.  Start atop a boulder.

content.description: This crack shares anchors with The Arborist and Easy Project. It leans significantly to the left. The start is the crux, then lots of liebacking and awkward mantling to get your feet in the crack.

Starting from the right side of the roof traverse left underneath the roof using a mixture of smeared feet and underclings until the roof ends. From here clip the second bolt and go straight up off of a good undercling to make a strenuous and reachy crux move to a good crimp followed by a finger crack on the left that takes some optional gear and will lead you to the anchor. The crux maybe easier if you’re tall but the start is easier if you’re short.
content.location: The bolted climb under the roof to the right of Phil’s Solo and just left of The Arborist.

content.protection: Shares same anchor as Arborist and No Jam Crack
content.location: 5 feet left of No Jam Crack

content.description: Short, technical face.  Follow the first bolted line right of Sunset Crack.  This one seems impossible at first, but in the end it's just like anything else:  you gotta use your feet.
content.location: Between Sunset Crack and Swimming with the Karp.  Rappel or scramble down to the right.

content.description: Climb up the crack to the small tree ledge. then head right to the bolt anchor.
content.protection: Two bolts at the top on the climb off to the right
content.location: At the base of the Lower Sunset Walls.

content.description: Shady all day long pretty much. Can get a little windy as well
